page.title: 08Waid Academy Anstruther
page.content: Waid Academy celebrates its centenary next session. We will be the hundredth group of children to begin first year. In 1800 Lt. Andrew Waid left money and instructions that a school"Waid's Orphan Academy" was to be built on ground he owned. It was to take in, accommodate, clothe and educate orphan boys and seamen's sons living in poverty. They were to wear blue sea- style suits and red neckcloths. For various reasons the school was not completed until 1886. Called "The Waid Academy" built not on Lt. Waid's land but on the north side of the town, it admitted 94 pupils, both boys & girls. The fees were a minimum of Â£2 per year but there was free education for 10 children, preference given to orphans. We look forward to the many special celebrations planned for next session.
